Pablo Oliveira Antonino de Assis

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/5091634871775902
  • Última atualização do currículo em 16/09/2019

Dr. Pablo Oliveira Antonino de Assis is a senior engineer and project manager at the Fraunhofer IESE in Kaiserslautern, Germany. His work focuses on the construction and analysis of architectures of dependable embedded systems from various domains such as automotive, agriculture, medical devices, and avionics. Dr. Oliveira Antonino received a Bachelor degree in Computer Science from the Federal University of Paraiba, Brazil, a Bachelor degree in Technologies of Telecommunications from the Federal Institute of Education, Science and Technology of Paraíba, Brazil, a Master degree in Computer Science from the Federal University of Paraiba, Brazil, and concluded his PhD (Dr.-Ing.) in Computer Science at the University of Kaiserslautern, Germany, in 2016. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2012 - Atual
Uma Contribuição ao Estabelecimento e Avaliação de Arquiteturas de Referência para Sistemas Embarcados
Descrição: Edital MCT/CNPq 14/2011 - Universal, Processo: 474720/2011-0..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Pablo Oliveira Antonino de Assis - Integrante / Martin Becker - Integrante / Elisa Yumi Nakagawa - Coordenador / Flavio Oquendo - Integrante / José Carlos Maldonado - Integrante.
2010 - Atual
CESAR - Cost-efficient methods and processes for safety relevant embedded systems
Descrição: "The embedded safety-critical systems design and development industry is facing increasing complexity and variety of systems and devices, coupled with increasing regulatory constraints while costs, performances and time to market are constantly challenged. This has led to a profusion of enablers (new processes, methods and tools), which are neither integrated nor interoperable because they have been developed more or less independently, addressing only a part of the complexity issue, such as safety. The absence of internationally recognized open standards is a limiting factor in terms of industrial performance when companies have to select among these enablers. CESAR will bring significant and conclusive innovations in the two most improvable systems engineering disciplines: * Requirements engineering in particular through formalization of multi viewpoint, multi criteria and multi level requirements, * Component based engineering applied to design space exploration comprising multi-view, multi-criteria and multi level architecture trade-offs. Multi-viewpoint based development processes assure that not only functional aspects but also safety, costs, robustness, timeliness, etc. are captured and documented in a form allowing validation and verification to be performed. Multi-criteria based design processes allow for optimization of designs to multiple objectives functions for such extra-functional characteristics of designs, a key for achieving competitive products. Multi-level design flows cover all stages from initial concepts through requirements through specification to design and implementation, typically crossing multiple stages in supplier chains. The combination of these aspects will allow movement towards "first-time-right" designs, where the actual integration phases are free of negative surprises. In addition, CESAR intends to provide industrial companies with a breakthrough in system development by deployin.
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Pablo Oliveira Antonino de Assis - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Artemis Joint Undertaken - Remuneração.
2010 - Atual
OptimAAL - Kompetenzplattform für die Entwicklung und Einführung von AAL-Lösungen
Descrição: Improvement of existing Reference Architectures of Ambient Assisted Living platforms..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Pablo Oliveira Antonino de Assis - Integrante / Martin Becker - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Bundesministeriur fur Bildung und Forschung - Outra.
2010 - Atual
Innovation Cluster for Digital Commercial Vehicle Technology
Descrição: Set up in close cooperation with leading industrial partners such as Robert Bosch, Daimler, John Deere, Haldex Brake, Keiper, Schmitz Cargobull, GE Transportation Systems and Volvo. The aim is to enhance the research and development skills of the industrial partners and enable them to improve their engineering processes for system reliability..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Pablo Oliveira Antonino de Assis - Integrante / Thorsten Keuler - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Fraunhofer Institute for Experimental Software Engineering IESE - Outra.
2009 - Atual
SiSOA - Sicherheit in Service-Orientierten Architekturen
Descrição: Address Security aspects in Service Oriented Arquitectures.
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Pablo Oliveira Antonino de Assis - Integrante / Reinhard Schwarz - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Fraunhofer Institute for Experimental Software Engineering - Outra.
2009 - Atual
HATS - Highly Adaptable and Trustworthy Software using Formal Models
Descrição: The HATS project develops a formal method for the design, analysis, and implementation of highly adaptable software systems that are at the same time characterized by a high demand on trustworthiness..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Pablo Oliveira Antonino de Assis - Integrante / Reiner Hähnle - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): European Commission 7th Framework Programme - Outra.
2009 - Atual
AUDI ePerformance
Descrição: The goal of the research project ?ePerformance? is to design the electric drive train in a completely new way, to systematically optimize all electric components in a vehicle, and to increase efficiency. The ambitious project intentionally pushes the technological limits, and is thus aimed at high performance classes. The final result will be an automobile that is the product of a completely new development while being sportive in the way that is typical forAudi..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Pablo Oliveira Antonino de Assis - Integrante / Mario Trapp - Coordenador.
2007 - 2009
Design Checker: Verificação e Rastreamento da Evolução de Desenhos de Software
Descrição: O objetivo deste projeto é desenvolver técnicas e ferramentas que suportem a verificação, o rastreamento da evolução e a avaliação dos impactos gerados por mudanças em desenhos de software no desenvolvimento. Tais ferramentas oferecerão suporte automatizado às fábricas de software da Unitech para o controle de qualidade dos produtos desenvolvidos..
Situação: Desativado; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Pablo Oliveira Antonino de Assis - Integrante / Dalton Dario Serey Guerrero - Coordenador / Jorge Cesar Abrantes de Figueiredo - Integrante.
Financiador(es): CPM Braxis Outsourcing - Auxílio financeiro.
